result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin D. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Pay fine of $300.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
**Pay DNA surcharge. May Not have contact with Azarian Wrecking Co or any of their projects.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Andrea Rufo.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:24pm-  Victim rights compliance.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 18 months w/conditions - consecutive to revocation in 06CF1311.  Court orders $300.00 fine plus costs & DNA surcharge.  No restitution requested.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously provided).  Appeal rights given.
3/31/2014 Sentencing hearing is moved to 4/1/2014 at 2pm - Attorney Rufo is out ill.  Parties notified via email.

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Andrea Rufo.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:20am-  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty; found guilty by the court.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Bond continued.
Plea hearing on February 14, 2014 at 08:45 am.
Due to ongoing jury trial (State v. Taylor), 2/6/2014 Plea hearing is rescheduled to 2/14/2014 at 8:45am.  NTBS by the Court.

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Andrea Rufo. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Zapf.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Plea hearing on 2-6-14 @ 10:30am. Bond continued.

120pm
  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk LE.  Preliminary Hearing set on 1/30/14 @ 830am before Comm Mason, 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI.  Atty Perz moves to dismiss Ct 1.  Court denies motion.  $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).

*No Contact w/property located at 1809 44th St.  *No discussion of this case with Gary L B
